data.text:
Brazilian Real is the official currency of Brazil abbreviated as BRL which is also known as the currency code of Brazil. The Brazilian Real is symbolically represented as R$. The Brazilian Real is regulated by the Central Bank of Brazil.

Brazilian Real (BRL) Currency Facts

BRL Stats BRL Profile Currency Name: Brazilian Real Central Bank: Central Bank of Brazil Symbol: R$ Freq. Denominations: R$2, R$5, R$ 10, R$ 20, R$ 50, R$ 100 Subunit: Centavo Coins Used: 5, 10, 25, 50 Centavos

Top BRL Conversions:

BRL to USD

BRL to INR Chart

History of Brazilian Real (BRL)

Brazilian Real was first introduced as the legal tender in Brazil on July 1, 1994, replacing the earlier currency Cruzeiro Real (CR $) as part of a broader plan to revive the Brazilian economy. Initially, the value of Brazilian Real was fixed at par with the US dollar which meant that one Brazilian Real was equivalent to one US dollar at that time. However, with time and market adjustments, Brazilian Real depreciated against the US dollar. Currently, it required about 4.15 Brazilian Reals (BRL) to buy a US dollar (USD).

About Brazil

Brazil is the world’s fifth-largest country (by area) and also the fifth most populous country in the world. Geographically, Brazil is situated in South America and bounded by the Atlantic Ocean on the east with over 7000 Km long coastline. Because of the world-famous Amazon forest, the region is home to the diverse ecological system which consists of vast tropical forest, a variety of wildlife and rich in mineral resources.
